meanings.definition: To fill or close with putty.
meanings.sent1: She puttied the hole in the wall to keep out the cold air.
meanings.sent2: He puttied the window frame to prevent any leaks.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel puttied its stash of acorns in a secret spot.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt puttied after the breakup, sealed off from further pain.
meanings.sent5: The old house was puttied together, each crack filled with care.

meanings.definition: To apply putty to a surface.
meanings.sent1: They puttied the cracks in the sidewalk to make it smooth.
meanings.sent2: The handyman puttied the edges of the glass before installing it.
meanings.sent3: The chef puttied the edges of the pie crust for a unique design.
meanings.sent4: The artist puttied the canvas, preparing it for the masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: She puttied the sculpture, shaping it with precision.

meanings.sent1: The puttied window was now draft-free.
meanings.sent2: The puttied seams of the boat kept it afloat.
meanings.sent3: The puttied jar lid refused to budge, holding in the freshness.
meanings.sent4: His puttied heart was finally protected from further hurt.
meanings.sent5: The puttied cracks in the wall were invisible, blending seamlessly.
